title: Can we live without God? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, what you mean by God. According to mythology, God is the energy that is inside you and arround you..everything in this universe consists of energy. This question is just like “Can a man live without any form of energy”.. How Silly..right !? The life energy inside you is also the energy of god. God can be easily defined as “the one who can not be seen or can not be touched” but can be felt by the ones who believes in the presence of him.. There are many theists & atheists in the world.but these theists are in many groups like Hindhuism,jainism,islam,christianism,budhism..etc These all religions believes god but they quarrel among themselves because they believe that only their path(religion) to reach god right.but this fighting is immature When they become mature enough to understand about god.they do not fight among themselves.. By the way..lets come to the point.. I’ve told you that the life energy inside you&me and inside all the living beings in the world is also the form of god. You are living because he is present in your body.When you dont realize that he is not in you then you will see yourself as a pile of flesh & bones & blood. But it is more than that..when you realize this you can start the journey of knowing the god. You can not make a dead man live with his pile of blood & flesh & bones. you can not make life energy(god) enter into his body..because you are in control of god but god is not under your control.. Physics says that “ Energy neither be created nor destroyed but it will change from one form to another” Can anyone say “How was this energy took its origin, and from where it was originated ?” No..right I say that this energy is the God..It is presence in many forms but it is one.. Life of all the living beings is depends on this Energy.Every human those who have said that they can live without god in the previous answers given for your question.. You can ask them that “ anyone of them is capable of creating the energy without using other forms of energy (or) can anyone live without using this energy in the universe(i mean they should not take energy like ..not eating, not inhaling air ,not drinking water..because these are also some forms of energy in the universe) None of them are able to do.. So, i can conclude this.. Any one can live without seeing or experiencing god..but no one can live without God.. Hope this is helpful..

Without doubt people live without God, Although you would have to ask yourself the question; What do you mean by the word ‘live’ ? I was a very unhappy individual so many years ago until the age of 22 when I discovered a peace that passes all understanding. Life is filled with burdens and cares and the presence of evil, Many people are alive but unable to really live the life that they were intended to live because of skewed conceptions about what life is and who God is. I had many questions when I was younger and believed in God but didn’t realize the life he desires us to have is not oftentimes like the life we think we should have, People on this planet can so often complicate life by evil intentions, pride and ego and selfish ambitions. Real life should reflect the life of heaven, which is meant to be simple and enjoyable but life on earth because of evil, suffering, sickness and our lack of trust in God because of these things, makes our life so often filled with fear, sadness, dread, and anxiety, life is never meant to be this way ! I used to worry ( and still tend to ) about a lot of things but it is a daily thing to leave all my anxieties on Gods altar, the Bible says ‘have no anxiety about anything but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God and the peace of God which passes all understanding will guard your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus’ None of us can avoid the evil and suffering and terrible tragedies of this world, but in spite of these things they do not have to rob us of the peace that passes all understanding that the Bible is talking about, I have suffered two benign brain tumor operations and other traumatic events in my life the past 38 years since I became a Christian, but I have been fortunate to survive. I don’t know why some people pass away early and others ( seemingly evil ) tend to prosper. The fact is that in the end death comes to everyone but we do not have to live in a state of foreboding and despair because of a lack of purpose, That’s exactly how I was 38 years ago but my life changed for the better You can live your life on your own terms without God, but there will be so many questions unanswered and eternity will be something you’ll never be sure of or have peace about, Real faith in God causes you to trust, be joyful and be thankful for a REAL life that is worth living and so much more fulfilling than just an existence ! I hope this is of some help to someone.

Been there.. Tried that.. but I wouldn't advise it. I never ever knew how desperately empty my life was before I gave my life to Jesus Christ. There's just NO COMPARISON. Emptiness is what my life was. There's also definately something to be said for being part of the larger fraternity of the Family of God and having a Father relationship with God. Jesus Christ said He is the way, The TRUTH and THE Life…but without Him there is no way to the Father. It's completely true. (Romans 10/9:10) At one time (after I had been a believer for a number of years) I went through a tough time when everything went really bad on me, so silly me thought it was because God didn't love me anymore…so I thought that if God could drop me like that then this wasn't what I expected of God Who said He would never leave me or forsake me (Jesus) and so I put my Bible away and turned my back on Him. It was ME Who had the problem after that …because if I thought I had problems before, when I was WITH God, they weren't problems at all, compared to the following 14 years. I almost lost my life.. And I'm still carrying the remnants of that with me today. So then my life returned in 2011 when I came back to God.. The ONE Lesson I learned was… “Dont even THINK ABOUT LIFE WITHOUT GOD” because not only do you have no Spiritual protection (no cover), but you are not under any Pastoral authority and protection either. ESPECIALLY if you are or were a believer…that is Spiritually extremely dangerous.

Yes and no. In the physical sense, no. God sustains all life, so nothing can come into being or continue to exist without Him. Apart from His sovereign will and power nothing can live, including human beings. In the spiritual sense, no. Without the Spirit of God in a man there can be no spiritual unity or fellowship with God, which is the essence of spiritual life. Man lives forever no matter where he goes after this life; it is not eternal existence that unity with God gives him, but eternity with God. Spiritually unregenerate men will spend eternity apart from Him. God did not create humankind to be able to function optimally without subjection to Him, although He gave us free will to live otherwise. The moral dilemmas of mankind and the failures of governments and various social movements and human ideologies are evidence of that. Our consciences and our logic alone are not sufficient to achieve a perfectly just and peaceful world. Man is not competent to be his own god; he needs a higher moral authority than himself. Humanity can and does exist without subjection to that authority, but as we can all see, from human history and the events of the present day, the results are perverse and tragic.

Till date, I have lived with God. And in future too. But, I think man can live without God. To explain it further, I would like to know what is living with God means. If living with God means walking on the path shown by Him. Then, one can say, one can live with God. And, if living with God means not walking on the path shown by Him. Then, that is what most of the people are doing nowadays. Anyway, A man can live without God. Of which the great example was a living legend till last year was none but an epitome of courage and hope who was left paralysed on the wheelchair at the age 17 due to an extremely rare disease — ALS or LOU. Even the doctors said they could not do much. Still, he lived till the age of 76. Did you guess the man? If not, then, another hint is there. The man who was equal to Einstein in intelligence, a legend of Cosmology and studied 'Black Holes' was none other than Dr Stephen Hawking. More importantly, he was atheist or non believer of God.  In the world, there is an unaffiliated group who are non believers of God. In some communist country like China and Russia, most of the people are atheists. This shows that man can live without God. Thank you.

What we call god is actually the seven stage muscle tone based default human thinking mechanism.  However, gods of different religions use different number of stages, which makes people of different religions think different and thus incompatible. It is for this reason that it is supposed that religions divide people.  Therefore, attempts are made time and again to unite people of all religions.  What if all gods vanish into thin air? Then will all human beings become one homogenous pool? No, when there are no gods and no seven stage thinking, then let alone two human beings, not even two of our thoughts would be compatible with each other. Life will keep on changing endlessly. Do communits counties prove that god is not a must? Communism is based on the fact that under ideal condtions we don’t need god. Therefore, these contries create an illusion of reality that its citizens are leading an almost ideal life. Thus, media control by the rulers is a must here. There wasn’t even one single day in the entire history of mankind on which non believers became more than believers. There won’t be a day in the future also.

Well,the fact that I am answering this question is an answer to this question.And u know,I reject god and I am living my life happily because bro,I have seen that most of the people say that believing in god gives us faith and confidence and also stops us from choosing the wrong path and it also gives you internal piece but I don't believe in all this shit. For me,I don't need any faith in God because I believe in myself,I lead myself and I make my own choices,I know what is right and wrong so no one can misguide me and god is not the one giving us air to breathe and land and water to live,it's our mother Earth which is giving this all to us and there is no proof that god made mother Earth. So I choose to respect and follow mother Earth in place of god, people spend millions on god every year but only few spend to help our earth, I believe in doing good deeds instead of sitting at a place and praying to God because that's the stupidest thing a person can do. Another reason I don't believe in God is that if he/she is actually real then why millions of innocents die every month and why do our earth has to suffer even though it has done only good deeds and is providing life to billions of people,if the god is that much almighty then why does he let innocent beings suffer. In the end,u really don't need god to live your life peacefully,u just need faith in yourselves and do good deeds and that will make your life an happier one, god is just an individual created by people to impose their failures and shortcomings on, people who fail to do something say that god is not with me,so I can't do anything, terrorists can't justify their lust for killing people so they justify it by saying that we are doing it in the name of Allah (their god). So have faith in yourselves and do good deeds and no god can even touch you then.

Man cannot achieve the purpose for which he or she has been created which is to save his or her soul and live in God’s presence in heaven for ever unless he loves God above all things in this short life on Earth. This has profound theological implications. The exemplary lives of the saints who faithfully followed Christ show us the way to God the Father. And the perfect example of holiness is Christ himself. Saint Therese of Lisieux, France who died at the age of twenty-six is an example of true humility and child-like trust in God. Her biography can be heard on-line as an audio-book. Holiness is a child-like humility in the presence of God. During the apparitions of Our Lady of Fatima, Portugal in 1917, the three children Jacinta, Lucia and Francisco had a vision of Hell which terrified them. This vision showed the children the fate of souls who reject God. Our Lady told the children to continually pray and do penance for the salvation of souls and to spread the message of prayer and penance so that many souls can be saved. The messages of Fatima remain true now as they were in 1917.

Yes, we can. And, trust me, it’s better to live in the reality of life as it is, rather than believing in something that was man made to justify heinous crimes and to take money out of people to build the “churches”. Please, look around. There’s no “god”. If there was truly a “god”, this world would be completely different. There would be no evil, no cancer, no kids dying from starvation, and no BULLSHIT. Believe in yourself. You’re god. Be good. Help others. That’s god. Be kind, don’t lie. That’s god. Save a life. That’s god. Hell is on earth.

No. I'm deciding to take this question in a different way then it may have been intended. Although God is typically capitalized to signify the Christian God, I'll see this as a more generic God. And at least for me, that definition means to have a belief in a higher power. Now, I consider myself an atheist, although I still visit Church on Sunday as its a tradition that my family demands. But I do have a belief in something that can be seen as a higher power: SCIENCE!  Forgive me for the image, I just immediately think of him when I yell science. Anyway, although I don’t believe in the God or a god, I still believe in a higher power. I imagine that’s how it works with everyone, even if you don’t believe something, that’s a belief. It’s like that one Socrates comic;  Everyone believes in something, and as I consider god to be a belief in a higher power; you can’t exist without god. And if you don’t believe in anything, are you were even human?

I’m not sure how well my answer will fit, being that I’m not religious, and answering a question under a religious category. But I’ll give it a go anyways, all the while remaining as unbiased as I can. I am an atheist, and even for the short time that I was religious, I never developed what truly religious people call “a connection with god” so essentially, I have “lived a life without god” but not in such a way that I have succumbed to meaninglessness and despair. You see, I believe (like most atheists) that mankind created religion to serve very specific social needs within humanity. Perhaps the most significant of these, is the human need for a construct of higher ideals and hopes to believe in, otherwise one can find himself/herself wallowing in a pit of existential madness, such as the strife and chaos that can now be witnessed in most of western civilization, where everyone is known to drink/drug themselves into unconsciousness while the whole world crumbles around them. Nobody, even the most skeptical atheist, has the ability to completely deprive themselves of this need, it has become an innate component of human nature. When most religious people quote the great German philosopher, Friedrich Nietzsche, who coined his very infamous phrase “god is dead” they neglect to include the very revealing second half of the quote: “god is dead… and we have killed him” it is absolutely NOT a celebration of the decline of Christianity, nor is Nietzsche promoting Nihilism. He is operating as a diagnostician. Nietzsche feared that the decline of Christianity in the West would result in a society-wide plunge into nihilistic hopelessness, and it seems time has proven him right. But he proposed that rather than using religion to serve these philosophical needs, which he believed to be a short cut that is actually detrimentally unhealthy for the human mind, that the true solution is to create your own source of this meaning through your own philosophical rationalization. This I have done, being a musician/artist, I use my works to bring this meaning into my life. but to answer your question, as an atheist, I believe it is possible to live a life without god. But to live a life without the philosophical ideas and meanings that religion represents? Of that, I am not so sure. If so, it likely won’t be possible for thousands of years, until we reach the next stage of consciousness.

Yes, you can live your life without God. That is because He has given you respite until you die. But you can’t be alive without Him.  God can live without you, of course. He doesn’t need you, but some of you guys are too arrogant and think to yourselves that God really needs you when He doesn’t. He created the universe for only He knows how long exactly, and then He was there before He created you ungrateful people. He doesn’t care if you hate Him, or mock Him, If you say, “Why doesn’t Allah guide me if He’s so powerful?” and then you say, “Why does someone like Allah need me so much?” you’re pretty much rejecting guidance.

You can. Many do. You have free will. I wouldn’t recommend it. In fact I can’t live without Him. It would take me hours and pages - and I’m willing to share - to tell you all He has done for me, the minimum 4 miracles He has performed in my life, that has left me absolutely unable to question His existence. Life without God. Yes you can. But on Earth it’s so much richer, Fuller with Him. And then there WILL be the afterlife, that’s a promise. At best, Hell is external separation from God. At worse? Eternal torment. Tbh, I’m not sure what Hell will look like. I do know I don’t want to be separated from my God who has done so much for me. Who has loved me when I didn’t love myself. Who saved my child when doctors gave up on him. I knew want to be without Him, now and forever.🙏🏻

Many of us, including me, think we are living without God. So yes, I say. But maybe you’re asking something more subtle, like — how do you get by if you don’t believe in God? Many atheists here on Quora will tell you actually, everything is super-awesome, if you don’t believe in God, much better than it is for you loser theists. But that’s not what I think. I think it would be comforting, if somewhat perplexing, to believe in God. Without that belief, you have no assurance that the good guys are going to win, and things are going to work out in the end. That can be very difficult to live with. But that’s how the world is. The truth, in general, is not very easy to live with. But if things *are* going to work out well, we had better start with the truth. God isn’t going to save the world, or each other, from our decisions, so we had better make them well.

Well I do. I haven’t been blessed and I am thankful for that. Don’t get me wrong, I am as religious as one can be if that means being a good person. But I can’t go to church and pretend any of the stuff that is going on there resonates with me. I was infected by the Jedi, though. I am no saber swinging monk, but I try to be patient, helpful and happy for people who achieve something. I try not to be afraid of anything, not to hate anybody and not to be envious My wife said once than I am more religious then most who proclaim they have faith. Because so many of them act quite the opposite. I knew that is not really true as there are still many good religious people, but I got her point. And was flattered. Some would say there is an act of God right there, but I resent that. It takes effort not to be pulled to the dark side. And I am selfish in a way I believe all the credit is solely mine.

I mentioned this question when answering another so it seems appropriate to write a few things here as well. The other question: Brian Dean's answer to How hard is it to have some respect and say God instead of god? This question seems to get it backwards and should end with ‘a god’ rather than ‘God’. Hmmm. I was going to suggest that Patrick Earley is a Christian ignorant of other religions, ones that don’t worship the Capital G God he does but his list of nigh 20,000 questions suggests that he is instead, or in addition, a sort of question spammer that the Quora Partner Program inexplicably encourages.

No, you can’t live without God because God is you. God is infinite or omnipresent. That means he’s everywhere to infinity. That means there is only ONE. You can have only one infinity. If you add anything to it, there’s no infinity. So either God is all there is and he’s playing all the parts, or there’s God and you and me, in which case God is just another lump of matter somewhere. ‘For in him we live and move and have our being.’ As some of your own poets have said, ‘We are his offspring.’ - Acts 17:28

Of course we can.That’s what we do now, in case you haven’t noticed. Do you need God to show up and tell you that if you are hungry, you should eat, or have you managed to connect the “eating of food” and the “disappearance of the tummy ache”? Is God holding your hand every single moment? Do you remember to breathe when He looses your hand? If you survive these things, that is only because you can do so. There is exactly zero evidence that proves there is a God, so what reason do you have to believe you need (a) God to exist?

Well, according to the Qur’an, God does not need any of his creations. It is up to us whether we need him or not. So the answer is yes, many people live without God. But there are more people living with false God. That is why the prayers of kaafirs often do not get answered — because they don’t know what true God is. They find nothing in their misguided religions apart from disappointment, that’s why they leave it. True God is not numerous, true God is not Jesus Christ, true God is pure mind and he is above everything.

Yes. This is known as a Vampire. When crossing the abyss if you have the keys to the gates you can cut connection with source and become a sovereign being. Once this happens you cannot draw energy directly from Sophia or Gaia. You cannot connect through Christ Conciousness either. At this point source energy must be drawn in from other humans that still contain god-source energy. This is from the standpoint of scientific illuminism.

No. Living and existing are two different things. Without God, life has no meaning. You’re just existing. You wake up every day doing the monotonous things not knowing where you’re going. But with God in your life, you start living with purpose. You find your identity in Him. When trials come, you are able to thrive and conquer because you know that God is by your side. You are more than just a body. You have a spirit. A spirit that longs for the purpose set by its creator. You can never live without a purpose. You are just mere existing. Don’t just exist. Live.

Certainly, especially if he has little contact with any religion. The church (and every religious community) would rather gather everyone in under their umbrella. It provides an income for their clergy, and by public brainwashing gives them a powerful influence over government and society. If you are not interested in their propaganda and false promises then you may live a good and carefree, guiltfree life, with far fewer worries. Of course support charities of your choice, be a stalwart pillar of society, be a friend to all around you and love honesty and honestly. You will sleep well on windy nights, as they say!

Can Life have meaning without God? It is by means of God’s spirit that all things exist. Therefore God is an inseparable part of life and existence. One can ignore the truth, but the truth will not ignore the individual. In the end, all will face judgment. Formal theological studies expose students to every form of human philosophy and psychology that conflicts with and attempts to discredit God and his word. It seeks to bend and mold students into secular definitions of God and populist beliefs that are contrary to his clearly written commands. Just as with Satan’s deceptive lie to Eve in the Garden of Eden, so organized religion and their “educators” attempt to trick and deceive students into an alternate vision of godliness and devotion. Unfortunately, that vision is contrary to God’s will. Be aware, students of theology, the Almighty God Jehovah has not changed. He is the same God since the beginning. His written message is not in conflict with itself. If you are led to believe that it is, study more thoroughly and continue in your prayers for truth. Do not let those who claim superior knowledge lead you astray. The truth is not far off from any one of us - neither is God.

Hello! Some may say they can live without God, they could be an Atheist. Well, in my opinion, we can’t live without God. We are created specially by God. Man is a spiritual being and having a spirit means he needs God. God is love. We exist because that love is sourced from God. We live because of his great love. Our lives here are just temporary and there is an afterlife. If we can live without God then why people are so empty and without peace of mind? Why we heard billionaires end his life? Why didn’t people know where they are going in the afterlife? In John 15:5, "I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing. Thanks

Sure…but merely in time* not for soooo long: eternally in eternity! *Time always runs out. Not alleged eons of time but TIMING: orchestration allowing sin-blinded-bondage-bias and evil that some may learn. Wake UP (not PC woke), sober UP, study UP, wise UP to grow-UP-right: faithful and true to, and like Most High God! You move from childHOOD to adultHOOD to a hoodLESS mature eternal-child of God after the Son: Christ's atonement or at-one-ment on the cross! The Way (super) cool as supernatural! Born natural-real of a mother. Born supernatural-true of the Spirit aka BORN again as confessing sins of the sin nature in fallen nature from the super nature of the Most High?

People, and indeed, the entire universe lives. This is an incontrovertible fact. We do not know, in a scientific way, whether God exists or not. So, the answer to your questions is, “Maybe so.” But we do know this, also incontrovertibly: Without the universe, people cannot live. So, what is the universe, anyway? We also know that in the world of things, I cannot be a thing that I have. For example, I am not my keyboard. Now, I have my mind. So, I have a question for you. Who has the mind that thinks it’s me? Consider well.

Well, I’ve been without God for at least 15 years. I was raised Catholic, and was even an altar boy. I gradually stopped believing there is such a thing as a God, stopped going to church, stopped praying, and became a staunch atheist. So far, I’ve been living just fine. I have a great relationship with my partner, a decent career, I don’t have any major health issues, I keep myself in decent shape, I have good friendships, and overall a good quality of life. So, taking myself as the barometer for “a man”, I would say one can do just fine without God. In fact, it doesn’t look like God gets much involved in human life at all. So pretty much all of men seem to be living without a God, whether they believe that or not.

A politically correct question would be: can a man or a woman live without God? And I can give you the correct answer - although it might be politically incorrect: YES men & women can live extremely happily without any religious ballast - hundreds of millions do, and if hell existed it would be the biggest building site in the universe having to make room for all those “lost souls”.

Of course. Over 7 billion people do every day. Oh, yeah, some of the believe in one or more gods, but different people believe in different god(s). The logical conclusion is that all of the gods that people worship have been made up by humans over the years and that the ones being worshiped today are no more real than Thor, Zeus, or Osiris.

Yes. It is not because people reject God that they seem to live happy and fulfilled lives, but it is because they are unable to live happy and fulfilled lives that they go looking for God. The updated question is more flawed than the original. Edit: Question twice edited by quora, no patience to keep changing my answer. 2nd edit to the question was : Can man live without God? Why do many people who reject God seem to live happy and fulfilled lives?

Have you been paying attention to world events? We have been living without God since Adam’s day and things are getting worse. It isn’t hat God is not there. When Adam rebelled against God he was saying he could live without God’s direction. So God has allowed man to rule himself. But in Genesis 3:15 God declared he would take matters into his hands after man showed he could not successfully rule himself. That time is near.

God is the totality of the universe including visible and invisible parts. Everything is God and God is everything and there is nothing but God.  The invisible part and the visible part (universe) should not be considered as separate because visible part cannot exist without the invisible part (spirit).   So, you, me and everyone are part and parcel of God. Also, God does not have a form or shape, yet, He is omniscient, omnipotent and omnipresent.

“Can a man live without God?” Proper question: Can a man or a woman live without some god or other? Easily. A man or a woman can live without a god, but a god cannot live without at least one man or woman. Nobody needs a deity of sorts. What would be the purpose? to pray for help? I pray to a milk jug. The milk jug answers my prayers as often and in the same way religious people's deity answers their prayers.

Christianity says that Logos both in humans and in the world is from God. Someone who is conversant with Christianity and/or the Psalms will remember “God knit our innermost being.” as being an expression of that and perhaps something more as well. The metaphor being quite clear here in terms of God’s role in biology more broadly and DNA more specifically. Like the DNA helix and perhaps far more profoundly, God’s fingerprint and the fingerprint of Design are integrated and inter-twined into the process.

We've done alright so far, 100,000 years plus and no gods have EVER made an appearance. Personally I have done 60 years with ZERO imaginary friends, so it's safe to say gods are a completely useless concept.
Yes. We all do that.

The original question was “Can life have meaning without god?”Yes of course. However I personally don’t feel obligated to seek or create meaning for my life. I just live it with a few goals and guidelines in mind. My missions in life are to have and share as many positive experiences as possible, and to do what I can each day to be better than I was yesterday.

It has to be NO, As a Chrisitan, I believe God created everything including man, he also sustains it. So every breath we take is a miracle enacted by God. Can man live as though God doesn't exist? YES & many do… but what is interesting about this is that God said ‘Let us make man in our image’ So such people logically can have no self-image as a foundation and will also have a deficient free-will as that is part of God’s image. they will also potentially have no moral foundation as only God is ‘Good & perfect’.For me, atheism seems to demand more faith than believing in God.

Yes, if you mean without faith in God. We cannot live without His help, however, in any sense of the Word. People who reject God are fools, the Bible says, thereby proving the Bible is true and in eternity, there won't be any loud mouth unbelievers, ever.
There is indisputable evidence that millions of people have lived full lives without any of the millions of gods that have been invented.

Yes. There is no inherently objective meaning or purpose of life. Just as ancient superstitious humans invented gods and all other associated supernatural beings, places, forces, phenomena, and concepts to help them (albeit extremely poorly) explain the unknown, we give ourselves meaning and purpose, both as individuals and as a species. Or we don’t have to at all. It’s only ever up to us. Always has been, always will be.

Can a man live without God? No, because God is the same as nature and we are part of this integral and deterministic system. We can profess not to “believe” in God, but the issue is not belief. The reality is that God does not exist unless we reveal Him inside ourselves. Michael Laitman's answer to How do I know God exists? Kabbalah - Kabbalah Education & Research Institute

There are plenty of people out there that don’t believe in God and they haven’t died yet. But i like to feel and believe my life is better with my faith in God then without. Its up to each individual to see how they feel and how comfortable they are with the belief’s they choose whether to believe in God or not.

god is irrelevant. life has the same meaning with or without, which is this: the aggregate of effects that one’s conduct has upon sentient beings in the universe. meaning is bound up in consciousness. in fact, it would not be incorrect to say that integrated over all sentient beings, meaning is coextensive with the sum of all consciousness. and this is true whether there is a god. . . or not.

I don’t want to be difficult, but what does the word ‘God’ mean in your question? If it means a jealous, angry, vengeful entity that cares what you eat and criticizes your sex life, then YES. It is much better to live without this horrible concept. However, if by ‘God’ you mean ‘Love’. Compassion, kindness, respect, nurturing, joy, affection and peace - why would you want to live without that?

I find it harder to rationalize how life can have meaning with the christian concept of god. You believe the entire universe is predetermined by an absolute power and you have no free will. On top of that this god is petty and jealous of the beings that he himself created and controls. It's pretty hard to imagine a more meaningless existence actually.

Have you any evidence he/she lives with one? Get over the myth and start focusing on using the goodness of man and potential to make the world a better place , rather than lame excuses blaming gods and devils.

Of course. Many people live without a god for their entire lives. For many people, god/gods are nothing but fairy tales. Belief in something that doesn't exist does not make life or living one bit harder or easier than for anyone else.

Life doesn't have inherit meaning. Meaning is derived from the significance we place on our ambitions, our detractions, and the people we know. This existence is an infinite cycle. Things are born of matter, exist, and die. The entire universe, in fact, will one day die. You will too, you just have the amazing opportunity that only an unbelievably miniscule percentage of existing things in the universe have, the opportunity to perceive this great mystery. You have the sole ability to endure all of the strife and enjoy all of the prosperity and derive your own narrative for it. That is purpose enough.
Since there is no evidence in the existence of any deity, I think all people live without them, whether they want to admit it or not.

Personally, I believe if God did not exist, the universe and everything in it would not exist. Can man live without God? Yes. The sun continues to rise and set for the believers as well as for the unbelievers. The air continues to fill the lungs of the believers as well as the unbelievers. The plants and animals continue to grow and reproduce to feed the believers as well as to feed the unbelievers. Babies are born to believers and unbelievers alike.

Man can not live without a reference point for truth. Aware of our limitations as clever mammals, anytime we refer to truth we are implicitly expressing faith. Whether one refers to the truth as being more or less synonymous with God is up to you.

Easily. The real question is how can god live without man? Given there are countless gods out there it seems that they could just maybe, made up by man. Also gods’ total failure to appear anywhere is odd. It’s 2019. Time to stop believing in fairy tales.

The meaning of life is determined by individual judgement and experience. Something that gives meaning to life for one person could be meaningless and a waste of time to another. The people I know who have no belief in God have found great meaning in their lives. You can, too.

Can a man live without God? Since almost every person (person!) on the planet lives without almost every god ever imagined, you would have to say yes. No one gives most of the 5,000 or so gods (millions if you count Hindu sub-dieties) a second thought. That’s at least thousands of gods that people can live without, never even noticing.

Of course, I have a loving family and faith in myself, why would I need a god. What gets me is that someone asks “do you believe in God “ not is there a god but do you believe in god so it is only a belief that’s it so no god in reality.

Of course. In fact, many countries with less than 38% religious population seem to have a more organized government, less public shootings, a far superior education system, and are generally cleaner countries. There are less strict laws against nudity and censorship and people can be better entertained or enjoy better recreation without it being sexualized by the church community.

well i managed for 45 years without him and all was fine,im now a Pagan and i have the old Gods,but it has not made much difference to my life, If you need a God to “live” then you have no faith in yourself and it is very very sad indeed
